archetype_name: Family Low-Fat Mediterranean Light Plates (15–30, Mild)
name: Lemon-Oregano Chicken Kebabs with Brown Basmati and Cucumber-Tomato Salad
description: Oven-finished chicken kebabs with a bright lemon-oregano finish, served over fluffy brown basmati rice and a fresh cucumber–tomato salad. Light on oil and family-friendly.
prep_steps: Rinse 1 1/2 cups brown basmati rice in cold water until it runs clear.
Preheat oven to 220°C/425°F. Line a sheet pan with foil.
Quarter 1 cucumber lengthwise, then slice into half-moons.
Roughly chop 1/4 cup parsley and 2 tablespoons mint.
Zest and juice 1 lemon into a small bowl.
In a small cup, mix 1 tablespoon olive oil with 1 teaspoon oregano and a pinch of salt and black pepper for the kebabs.
cook_steps: Add rinsed brown basmati rice to a pot with 3 cups vegetable stock. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer 25 minutes until tender. Rest 5 minutes covered.
Place chicken kebabs on the lined sheet pan. Brush with the olive oil–oregano mixture.
Bake chicken kebabs for 12–15 minutes, turning once, until cooked through (juices run clear).

While kebabs cook, make the salad: In a bowl, combine cucumber, cherry tomatoes, red onion, parsley, and mint. Add half the lemon zest and 2 tablespoons lemon juice, 1 teaspoon olive oil, a pinch of salt, and black pepper. Toss and set aside.
Fluff the rice. Stir in remaining lemon zest and 1 tablespoon lemon juice, plus a pinch of salt if needed.
Brush the baked kebabs with any juices on the pan. Squeeze the remaining lemon over the kebabs.
Serve rice in bowls, top with chicken kebabs, and add the cucumber–tomato salad on the side.

Fluff the rice. Stir in remaining lemon zest and 1 tablespoon lemon juice, plus a pinch of salt if needed.
Brush the baked kebabs with any juices on the pan. Squeeze the remaining lemon over the kebabs.
Serve rice in bowls, top with chicken kebabs, and add the cucumber–tomato salad on the side.
